Cool video, but I take issue with their treatment of the word discovery. According to their argument against using it, there would never be a proper use for it at all.

Discovery is all about the perspective of the discoverer. So yes, it is fair to say that Europeans discovered the Americas. They just weren't the first to do so. And if these researchers were the first to confirm the existence of the Higgs-Boson, then of course you can say that they discovered it.

It fascinates me how language can change as it does. Apparently perfectly reasonable words that mean exactly what they are meant to mean can suddenly become widely considered incorrect or misleading, when used in their proper context, for no clear reason.

I suspect that it has something to do with political correctness.

as the particles energy dissipates it becomes less "stable" and the likelihood of it to decay into other particles increases until eventually it decays into other elementary particles.
